triples.name: Chatbot
triples.relevance: Chatbots are the central technology examined in this systematic review of language learning applications.

triples.name: Language education
triples.relevance: Language education is the primary application domain and focus of this systematic review.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: Natural language processing enables chatbots to understand and generate student conversations in language learning.

triples.name: Second-language acquisition
triples.relevance: Second language learning is one of three types of language learning specifically examined in this review.

triples.name: Systematic review
triples.relevance: Systematic review is the core research methodology used to conduct this analysis of chatbot-supported language learning studies.

triples.name: Grounded theory
triples.relevance: Inductive grounded theory approach is used to identify technological and pedagogical affordances from the reviewed studies.

triples.name: Social presence theory
triples.relevance: Garrison's social presence framework is used to analyze the social affordances of chatbots in language learning.
